unnormalised: The letter arrived addressed simply to "Shri R.K. Sharma, IAS". It had been years since anyone had used the honorific “Shri” on formal correspondence. Most now opted for Mr. or, less formally, just R.K. Sharma. Inside was an invitation to a reunion of his batchmates from the Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration. He hadn't seen most of them since their training ended back in '92. He remembered the lively debates with Ms. Fatima Khan, IPS, who was now heading a counter-terrorism unit in J&K.

unnormalised: Sharma Sahab, as he was known in his office, had risen through the ranks steadily. He’d started as a Sub-Divisional Magistrate in a small district in Bihar. Now, he was Additional Secretary in the Ministry of Rural Development, a position he’d held for the past 3 yrs. The work was demanding, filled with endless files, policy reviews, and meetings with various Joint Secretaries and Under Secretaries.

unnormalised: He recalled a particularly challenging case from his time as District Magistrate in Uttar Pradesh. A land dispute had erupted into a full-blown riot, and he, as the DM, had been responsible for restoring order. He worked day and night, coordinating with the SP, Mr. A.K. Singh, IPS, and local community leaders to bring the situation under control. He remembered thinking, "This is what it means to be a Collector."
